title: Question 9
prompt: What outcome would result, based on the author’s depiction, of investments in social businesses?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback: The author describes social businesses as self-sustaining businesses that try to achieve social goals. Because the businesses take in enough money to pay for their operations, they will require a minimum of investment. Because the businesses’ goals are social ones, they will lead to widespread social benefits. The author describes an idea that seems to lead to widespread social benefits with a minimum of investment.
